2.22.21  6:39 pm   which one of your songs would make the most sense played on a ukulele?
2.22.21  6:21 pm   How do I make something that's meaningful? I feel like everyone has meaning except for me.

2.22.21  6:08 pm   I teach singer/songwriters and I get a lot of the beginner songwriters coming to me and saying stuff like "I just don't know how to get the pieces of the song together. I don't know how it's supposed to sound. Why doesn't my song have a longer chorus? My phrases are too short! Blah blah blah" and they make these statements about the entirety of their work as if their songs need to be XYZ kind of way. It's like they want me to tell them that there's a RIGHT and a WRONG way to make a song good. And when I tell them that it sounds like they're asking for an acceptable formula, their eyes kind of glaze over. They say "I don't want my songs to be formulaic! I just want to know the right way to write a song" but in my mind those are the same thing. What I've told them is this - make up your own formula for an individual song. However you want the patterns to be and then fit your segments into the formula YOU create. I'm hoping at a minimum this will make t hem focu s more on their own instincts and less on right and wrong. But I can't tell. What do you think I should tell them?

2.21.21  10:39 pm   I want to write novels or a novel but I don't think I have experienced enough or understood enough to write anything worth people's time, or that would be worth my own time if someone else's name was on it. I still write, but I don't write novels yet. Do you think value in waiting for the right moment or does it sound like fear?
